text:
Same as any other open-source company, and there are plenty: Terraform(Hashicorp), Docker, RedHat, MongoDB, Elastic, DataBricks, ... . Open source is free, and you sell either additional products on top of it or you offer services like enterprise support and consultancy. The main idea is: if you have an open-source solution that is valuable enough and is catering to big enough market, there will be a lot of value to offer on top of it, and you will be in best position to capture that value and therefore monetize it.
We are not yet developing any products on top of Wasp, first we are focusing on the open-source part of it, but idea is to offer additional products on top of it - we will probably start working on those in a year, once open-source core is stable.

text: There are even funds that invest only in open source!

elements.text: There are even funds that invest only in open source!

text: Thanks for all the detailed info, I am now considering applying as well.

elements.text: Thanks for all the detailed info, I am now considering applying as well.

text:
Cool! YC is not the only startup accelerator, there are many -> if you are considering driving your project as a startup, there are many avenues to try, and a lot to learn. Most important thing is to have a vision of how you could build a big business on top of your project (big == 100M revenue per month).  YC also has a startup school which anybody can participate in, and it has great resources and videos, so consider taking a look at that: <https://www.startupschool.org/curriculum> .
What is the project you are working on btw?
Oh, and of course, if you can avoid raising money and instead being profitable on your own, often that is a better way to go - less stress and more control - but if you can't and need capital to become profitable, then it makes sense to consider raising capital (if you have a business case and ambition for it).

text: The project that I am working on is the flow based programming project of which I posted some video's here in this channel. The business vision part is something I surely have to work on. So far I could fund my own development because I receive some subsidy in a form of "tax discount" which helps a little bit
